title.rendered: Renowned Venezuelan journalist José Manuel Dopazo passed away

content.rendered:
• Colleagues from the union assure that the death was the product of a stroke. The Venezuelan communicator was based in Spain

The journalist José Manuel Dopazo, renowned anchor of Venevisión, died this Saturday, May 15, in Spain, the country where he had been based for a few years.

The communicator Endrina Yépez, also from Venevisión, confirmed the news through her social networks. Although she did not specify the cause of her death.

However, the journalist Euclides Sotillo indicated that Dopazo suffered a stroke.

The Zulian migrated from Venezuela and was fighting cancer.

Jose Manuel Dopazo. Photo: Courtesy / Archive

The National Association of Journalists (CNP) spoke after the news and lamented the death of the journalist who lived in Madrid, Spain.

The journalistic union lamented the news and, through social networks, have expressed their solidarity with relatives and close friends of the communicator.

The Venezuelan journalist Alba Cecilia Mujica dedicated a message to Dopazo and remembered him as a serious and responsible professional, “beautiful outside and inside.”

Moraima Gutiérrez Ferrer, also a communicator, described him as “a balanced, supportive, decent, helpful man.”

In Venezuela, Dopazo graduated from the University of Zulia (LUZ) and was a news anchor for the Venevisión newscast for 12 years.

Likewise, he twice won the Regional Journalism Award and the National Journalism Award in the mention “Television Opinion”, for the space “Encuentro con los Estudiantes”.

A hard blow, José Manuel Dopazo, a great colleague and friend. It’s a blow to the heart 💔 Fly high friend pic.twitter.com/mhYBz9cgbb

– Endrina Yepez (@ENDRINAYEPEZVV) May 15, 2021
